why.exists: Modernize aging customer portal to improve user experience and reduce support tickets
why.problem: Current portal has outdated UI, slow performance, and poor mobile experience causing customer frustration
why.vision: Self-service portal enabling customers to manage accounts, track orders, and resolve issues 24/7

who.stakeholders: CEO, VP Product, VP Support, 15 major customers, Support team (20 staff)
who.decision_makers: CEO and VP Product (final approval), VP Support (sign-off on requirements)
who.executors: Engineering team (6 devs), Design team (2 designers), QA team (3 testers)
who.concerns: CEO: ROI and timeline | VP Product: Feature completeness | Support: Ticket reduction | Customers: Stability and performance

what.building: Complete redesign of customer.company.com portal with modern React stack, improved search, and mobile-first design
what.features: Account management, order tracking, support ticket submission, knowledge base search, self-service refunds, document downloads
what.out_of_scope: Email notifications, API access for third-party integrations, custom theming per customer
what.success_criteria: Page load <2s, 90% uptime, 40% reduction in support tickets, NPS score >8, zero security incidents

rationale: Project has clear purpose and well-defined scope with sufficient resources. Yellow flags on stakeholder alignment (customer requirements still being refined) and timeline feasibility (6-month target may be aggressive). Risk of integration issues with legacy payment system. Recommend: Proceed with 4-week discovery phase to finalize customer requirements and migration strategy before full development kick-off.
